chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew Ivan Moncada

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court.  
Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court for Matthew Ivan Moncada.  
Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Room 400 Courthouse.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Anthony D Cotton in court.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for a defrred prosecution agreement hearing. Parties requested an adjournment of the hearing. Court granted the parties request. Court accepts the defendants other misdeamnor case for the purposes of the DPA. Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 07-25-2022

Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Alexandria S. Carlson for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Defense requested a Plea/Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing dates.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-3-2022

Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court with Attorney Anthony D Cotton; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 03-25-2022

Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in court with attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Matthew Ivan Moncada in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Any Pick n Save
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
